info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:32PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Columbia, eastern Albany, eastern Greene and Rensselaer Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 731 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coxsackie, or 11 miles northwest of Hudson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Troy, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Hudson, Catskill, Chatham, Nassau, Delmar, Latham, Guilderland, Claverack, Menands, New Baltimore, Ravena, Stephentown and Coxsackie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 24. Interstate 87 between exits 21 and 6. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central New York.
